page.title: 03FARMING AROUND BRIDWATER
page.content: To the south is very low lying land which flooded regularly. An intensive underground drainage system which runs into a large open channel -Stock Moor Rhyne has remedied this. There were no reeds or water plants - tell tale signs of badly drained land. This is now high quality farming land used for intensive dairy farming. The farmers' main aim is to produce large quantities of good quality milk at the lowest cost. To this end, he keeps Friesian cows which have the highest yield of all dairy cattle and he produces much silage for winter feed. The milk also has a reasonably high butter fat level. However, the public now prefer low fat milk because some medical opinion is that too much animal fat is unhealthy.
